lang

Class Function

  • java.lang.Object
    • lang.Function

  • public abstract class Function
extends java.lang.Object
    THIS CLASS HAS NOT BEEN FINISHED AND IS NOT RECOGNIZED BY EXPRESSION OR TERM A class to represent Mathematical functions. In order for the Algebra Processor to recognize a function, please register it with registerFunc(Function o).
    Author:
    Luke Senseney

      • registerFunc

        public static void registerFunc(Function o)

      • evaluate

        public abstract Term evaluate()
                       throws NotEvaluatable
        Attempts to evaluate the function.
        Returns:
        An Expression which is mathematically equal to this function.
        Throws:
        NotEvaluatable - If the function cannot be evaluated.

      • invert

        public abstract Function invert(Expression otherSide)
        Creates a Term with the inverse function of this with otherSide as the parameter.
        Parameters:
        otherSide - Generally the other side of the equation which is being solved, becomes the parameters.
        Returns:
        a Function that is the inverse of this, with otherSide as the parameter.

        public abstract java.lang.String getSig()
        Gets the signature, normally three letters which represent this Function.
        Returns:
        This Function's signature.
